html.p: What: Creates a human-readable time from _time, like "A day ago".

ol.li: Recently "updated" to add support for additional fields.

html.p: Why: Very useful for human-readable dates/times.
So What: The admiration of colleagues.
Was previously *very* limited, but recently they added some functionality. Still waiting for "future" timespans to work well though.

We'll use a customized makeresults that generates a list of various "times ago" to see how they behave. | makeresults format="csv" data="time_adjust -500 60 1000 30000 400000" | eval time = now() - time_adjust

panel.html: Works for quite far in the past (hundreds of years!) but all future dates just say future.
panel.title: Conversion of times to "16 minutes ago" by using reltime

search.query: | makeresults format="csv" data="time_adjust -500 60 1000 30000 400000" | eval time = now() - time_adjust | eval _time = strftime(time, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") | reltime timefield=time
